Introduction

Tim Darby ------ March 2011 ------

Maven License Validator Plugin

The license-validator plugin is intended to help with maven project artifact license management. The primarily feature is to be able to check the licenses on project dependencies and enforce licensing restrictions as desired through the configuration.

The information will be taken from the implied (or specified) pom and from the command line. The settings.xml file may also be parsed to retrieve user credentials.

This project is hosted at maven-license-validator-plugin on Google Code

Goals Overview

The license validator plugin has 1 goal:

  • license-validator:validate-licenses is used to automatically check license files on all dependencies (transitively if selected) and fail if the licenses do not meet the required acceptance criteria

How To Use

Instructions on how to use the license validator plugin including examples can be found here.
